record.dc:title: 10-492 John Ausmus Farm Site 3CE10, Claiborne County, Tennessee. Mound 2. Feature 13, A burned clay fire place, associated with the floor of the top structure, Feature 12. Direction northeast.
record.wpa:narrative: Layers of ash, charcoal, one stone discoidal. Well defined, but irregular in shape. Constructed of burned yellow clay, and appearing near north side of structure (feature #12). Bottom of fire place extends into floor underneath top floor. Filled with ash and charred wood. Note: this feature was not discovered until the floor of feature #12 was being cut away, thus the two levels are shown in photographs.
record.wpa:comments: Illustration on file with the institution. See also photograph 10-493 [fhm00344].
